Lift over fusion gene coordinates from hg19 to hg38 (multi-file version)

liftover_fusion_coordinates.Rd

This function accepts *multiple* input files (a character vector) in ChimerDB4-like format, combines them, and lifts over the coordinates from hg19 to hg38 using the UCSC chain file.

This function accepts *multiple* input files (a character vector) in ChimerDB4-like format, combines them, and lifts over the coordinates from hg19 to hg38 using the UCSC chain file.

liftover_fusion_coordinates(
  input_file,
  output_dir = ".",
  chain_file = NULL,
  column_names = NULL
)

liftover_fusion_coordinates(
  input_file,
  output_dir = ".",
  chain_file = NULL,
  column_names = NULL
)

Arguments

input_file

Character vector specifying the path(s) to input file(s). Each file should be tab-delimited in ChimerDB4 format (or similar).

output_dir

Character string specifying the directory where output files will be written. Defaults to the current working directory.

chain_file

Character string specifying the path to the chain file. If NULL (default), the function will download the chain file from UCSC.

column_names

Character vector of column names for the input file(s). If NULL (default), the function will use the default ChimerDB4 column names.

Value

A list containing three data frames:

combined

Data frame with both hg19 and hg38 coordinates (all files combined)

hg38_only

Data frame with only hg38 coordinates for successful liftovers

failed

Data frame with records that failed to lift over

A list containing three data frames:

combined

Data frame with both hg19 and hg38 coordinates (all files combined)

hg38_only

Data frame with only hg38 coordinates for successful liftovers

failed

Data frame with records that failed to lift over

Details

The function creates three output files in the specified directory (for *all* files combined):

chimer_data_hg19_and_hg38.txt

Contains both hg19 and hg38 coordinates

chimer_data_hg38.txt

Contains only hg38 coordinates for successful liftovers

failed_liftover.txt

Contains records that failed to lift over

The function creates three output files in the specified directory (for *all* files combined):

chimer_data_hg19_and_hg38.txt

Contains both hg19 and hg38 coordinates

chimer_data_hg38.txt

Contains only hg38 coordinates for successful liftovers

failed_liftover.txt

Contains records that failed to lift over

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Multiple files
liftover_fusion_coordinates(
  input_file = c("chimerdb4_file1.txt", "chimerdb4_file2.txt"),
  output_dir = "path/to/output"
)

# Single file still works (same interface)
liftover_fusion_coordinates("chimerdb4_file.txt")
} # }

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Multiple files
liftover_fusion_coordinates(
  input_file = c("chimerdb4_file1.txt", "chimerdb4_file2.txt"),
  output_dir = "path/to/output"
)

# Single file still works (same interface)
liftover_fusion_coordinates("chimerdb4_file.txt")
} # }
